intro: Deguelia spruceana, commonly known as the red spruce, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at higher elevations. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in mountainous regions. Deguelia spruceana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
